abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Second Agricultural
            Post-privatization Assistance Project for Kazakhstan is to
            enhance the access to commercial financial services by
            farmers and small or medium size rural enterprises. The
            project has five components: (i) rural financial advisory
            services, (ii) agricultural risk management, (iii) rural
            outreach by the mainstream financial institutions, (iv)
            rural micro finance development, and (v) project management.
            The project changes include: partial cancellation of the
            project funds; dropping of the price risk management
            subcomponent from the agricultural risk management
            component, amendment to loan agreement; and changes to the
            indicators of the three components affected by the partial
            cancellation and cancellation of the sub-component.
